summary: This is an FBI criminal history record (rap sheet) response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an inquiry. It contains standard identification and legal use caveats, and indicates the subject's DNA is not in CODIS but should be collected. The document is part of the Epstein case files.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency providing the criminal history record response.

events.title: FBI Criminal History Record Inquiry Response
events.description: The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services provides a criminal history record (rap sheet) in response to an FBI inquiry. The record includes identification data, legal caveats, and a DNA indicator.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
CBP-DULLES INTL ARPT; VACESP0600; STE 15 STERLING, VA 20166
keyFacts: The document is an official FBI criminal history record (rap sheet) response dated October 6, 2021.
It indicates the subject's DNA is 'NOT IN CODIS' but flags 'COLLECT DNA'.
The record is provided by the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services and is for official use only.
All entries are based on fingerprint comparisons and pertain to a single individual.
The document references an agency index including CBP-Dulles International Airport.
